alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 8:46AM MDT until June 27 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River at Fort Morgan. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, There is minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
